thread.title: Donald Trump Is Set to Boost Military Spending - WSJ
thread.title_full: Donald Trump Is Set to Boost Military Spending - WSJ

author: Michael C. Bender
title: Donald Trump Is Set to Boost Military Spending - WSJ
text:
Politics Donald Trump Is Set to Boost Military Spending Prime-time speech to Congress on Tuesday will call for $20 billion Pentagon rise, sharp cuts in other programs Speaking at a meeting with governors, President Donald Trump said on Monday his first budget will include a "historic increase" in military spending. He said the proposal will focus on public safety and national security. Photo: Reuters By Google+ Feb. 27, 2017 7:28 p.m. ET 
WASHINGTON—President Donald Trump, in an address to Congress on Tuesday, will call for a $20 billion boost in current military spending and sharp cuts in other programs, and insist on raising budget caps that call for future cuts to defense outlays. 
The prime-time speech is Mr. Trump’s first opportunity to formally address the nation since Inauguration Day, and aides said he will use that platform to highlight actions during his... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
